eat.title: Macehat
eat.description: Although this coffee shop is usually packed with people, it is worth to squeeze in and try their signature Avocado Coffee Float. The strong taste of coffee blends perfectly with the soft texture of avocado juice, topped with sweet and chocolatey taste of chocolate ice-cream. They have various snacks as well, though the Avocado Coffee Float itself is already fulfilling enough. If you prefer the original taste of coffee, they sure have the qualification. The downside is, as the place is usually packed and lots of people usually queueing, you can't really stay for long to chat. But don't worry, you can always jump into another place.
eat.mira: The Avocado Coffee Float is good, but it's somehow too sweet to my tastebud. (3/5)
eat.junda: I'm not a big fan of coffee nor avocado, but mix them up together with ice cream, the result is pure delight. (4/5)

eat.title: Sop Langsa
eat.description: Since Junda was little, his mom often feed him spinal cord of cows or chickens. He grew up liking it ever since. Once he heard that Medan has a soup restaurant that allows you to drink the merry thing, he wasted no time going there. For those who fancies a bit more spine in their life, we recommend giving Sop Langsa a try. There was a catch to this place though, one group can only order maximum 2 servings of spinal soup as cow spines are quite hard to come by. So if you came with a big group, divide your group into twos and pretend that you don't know each other.
eat.junda: A jolly in your belly. Though finishing the whole thing is known to be quite a chore. (3.5/5)

eat.title: Soto Medan Sinar Pagi
eat.description: Medanese usually eat this for breakfast. We know you've tried soto, but we swear this one will be different. Expect something like Soto Betawi, but it used coconut milk instead of fresh milk. The taste is richer, we guess it uses more herbs and spices inside. Mira likes it with beef inside, but Junda likes it mixed with the innards. The beef has rich smokey fragrance that blends perfectly with the soup. To add the perfection, it served with tasty green sambal. A helpful tip: mix the sambal with sweet soy sauce, you'll thank us later. The restaurant might seems busy all the time but I can assure you that they're the high-scorer in the Dinner Dash game as they will serve you quickly
eat.junda: Expect to get yelled at upon arrival, Medan-style. (4.5/5)

eat.title: Dimsum Nelayan
eat.cost: IDR 200k (for full belly and satisfaction), well depends on how much you eat
eat.description: Dim sum is not exactly Sumatera-flavored, but we strongly advise you to try one in Medan, specifically in Nelayan restaurant. Various types of dim sum are served there and will make you forget about your diet. Do try the leng hong kien (shrimp dim sum with mayonaise) and don't forget to add their special spicy sauce before putting it in your mouth. After stuffing lots of dim sum into your now happy belly, cherish your mouth by eating the dessert : durian pancake. Don't expect the pancake to be the round-shape American breakfast pancake. It's more like seedless durian fillings with fresh cream, wrapped with thin layer of pancake. If you don't like durian, try the avocado one, it's equally delish.
eat.mira: Prepare to get broke, as the waitress will keep coming with full tray of dim sum! (4/5)
eat.junda: Don't try durian pancake, try the avocado one instead (4/5)

eat.title: Mie Aceh Titi Bobrok
eat.description: Having the province of Aceh just around the neighbourhood, Medan is a right place to taste the pure Aceh flavour. Mie Aceh Titi Boborok is indeed one of the best Mie Aceh that we've ever tasted. We love it even more for it is really cheap (well, compared to Jakarta standard). For less than 20k you can have a full plate of Mie Aceh right in front of you. Choose it as you pleased, be it fried, stewed, or just a stir-fried (with a bit of soup, but not as wet as the stewed one). Beef, chicken, or even the whole crab as the topping. We love it wet, as we think it's more flavourful that way. And oh, do order the martabak telor!
eat.mira: To me, no mie aceh tastes as good as Titi Bobrok (4/5)
eat.junda: Once you try this one, no other Mie Aceh in Jakarta will taste good. (5/5)

eat.title: Lontong Medan Kak Lin
eat.description: We're telling you, Medanese LOVES fat. They cook their soto with coconut milk, and they like to add more and more to their other typical breakfast : lontong medan. Lontong Medan to Medanese is like bubur ayam and ketoprak to Jakartans, they're everywhere in the morning. What makes it different with other lontong sayur is, it has lots of things inside other than the sayur itself; it has tauco udang, bihun goreng, spicy anchovy, boiled egg, and sometimes with rendang as well. Rich and heavy, for breakfast standard. We usually eat the one that Kak Umi sells in Johor but we thought it would be more convenient if you go to Kak Lin. It is located in the heart of Medan city, just accross Mira's high school. If you do not like having fatty breakfast, she also sells lontong pecal.
eat.mira: Don't blame me if you gain a few kilograms after this. (3.5/5)
eat.junda: Try Lontong with Rendang, best taste under the heaven. (4/5)

eat.title: Mie Ayam Akong/Acim (Since 1975)
eat.cost: IDR 35k for one bowl of mie ayam
eat.description: Kudos to our beloved friend, Decci, who introduced us to this place. We love it ever since. It's been here since 1975, Decci's father and mother loved to eat here and chill when they were young. We love it cause it's different in a good way. Not your typical mie ayam. The texture of the noodles is nice, it has lumpia udang as the topping, as the addition to chicken and boiled eggs. The sambal and pickled chili will contributes to its perfection. Drink the freshly squeezed orange juice afterwards, it was not a regular orange juice. You're in heaven.
eat.mira: Should I book a ticket to Medan tomorrow? I'm drolling. (5/5)
eat.junda: Tastes sweet and salty at the same time, in a very good way. (4/5)

eat.title: Tip Top (Since 1929)
eat.address: Jl. Jend. Ahmad Yani No. 92 A-B
eat.description: This is the oldest shop in our list, established in 1929. Everything about this place screams old! They have dutch-period cashier registry and telephony that is now became parts of decoration, and wooden oven that is still fully functional as some of their cookies are made in this oven. We haven't try too much variety from their menu as they serve lots of alcoholic ice cream, but the ones that we do try is exquisite. You could also try the beef tongue steak. If you like sate padang, this is one click better.
eat.mira: Nice classic vibes but I prefer Es Krim Ria. (3/5)
eat.junda: Not as expensive as the outer appearance indicate. (3.5/5)

eat.title: Es Krim Ria (Since 1936)
eat.description: Mira's mother has been visiting this place since she was in elementary school with Mira's granddad. Which means that this is the classic taste that stood the test of time. She usually ordered ice cream soda and eat various assortment that served on the table. If the cake is not enough, you can always order martabak telor or sate padang from the stalls just in front of this shop. This is the place for you if you like Zangrandi in Surabaya, Tentrem in Solo, or Ragusa in Jakarta.
eat.mira: I like this kind of ice cream, light and not too sweet. It feels nostalgic. (4/5)
eat.junda: A very good taste, but was not easy to get here unless you rent a car. (4/5)

eat.title: Coffee Box
eat.description: If you landed in Medan on Saturday and fly back on Sunday, then unfortunately for you, you might be able to get only the drool. But fret not, Coffebox is the one-stop-solution for you. You can order lontong medan, sate kerang, mie rebus, martabak telor, Es Kietna, and various kind of foods here. ALthough to be fair, the taste was not as good as the original places we listed before. We love their Es Kopi Malaka and Bakwan Bumbu Pecel. Furthermore, it has cozy vibes and the so called instagramable (God, We hate this term) decoration. The place itself used to be an old town jail, so it have classic feel to it. We'd like nothing more that hanging-out here with friends.
eat.mira: When in doubt, go to Coffeebox. (3.5/5)
eat.junda: Can be crowded, but very nice when it was not. (3.5/5)
